greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Remove prime factors of form 4*k+1.
comment: All factors p^m of a(n) are of the form p=2 or p=4*k+3.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p)=(if p==1 (mod 4) then 1 else p).
mathematica: a[n_] := n/Product[{p, e} = pe; If[Mod[p, 4] == 1, p^e, 1], {pe, FactorInteger[n]}];
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, if ((f[i,1] % 4) == 1, f[i,1] = 1)); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 09 2014
return 1 if n == 1 else prod(i**f[i] for i in f if i%4 != 1) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 08 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 17 2002
